text: The Bombardier HR-412, also known as the MLW HR-412, was a 4 axle, freight locomotive manufactured in Montreal, Quebec, Canada. Ten were built for Canadian National Railway in between September and November 1981, numbered 2580-2589, and one was built for Bombardier as a demonstrator in May 1982, numbered BBD 7000. BBD 7000 was later sold to Canadian National. The model designation stood for HR - High Reliability, 412 - 4 axles, 12 cylinder engine. The HR-412 was designed as the successor to the MLW M-420. == See also == * List of MLW diesel locomotives ==References== * HR-412 HR-412 Category:B-B locomotives Category:Railway locomotives introduced in 1981 Category:Diesel-electric locomotives of Canada Category:Canadian National Railway locomotives Category:Standard gauge locomotives of Canada Category:Freight locomotives
title: Bombardier HR-412
